user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
The product description clearly states that the colours are lightweight and it is more of a sheer pigment, so I do not understand the reviews dragging this palette because of the lack of pigment. The palette is beautiful, perfect to create a natural look. I have a fair skin and these are one of those rare blushes that do not make me look like a clown with one swatch. I recommend this to anyone who has fair skin or prefers to build up the colour. I also love using this as a base before applying a more pigmented blush.

review_title: No pigment, not worth the money
review_content: Where is the pigment promised in the swatches? I've been wanting a NARS blush palette forever and finally made the splurge and got this one because their individual blushes are so damn good. But there is no color pay off. I have tried to apply with my fingers and several different blushes and there's nothing not even from the deep burgundy blush. Absolute waste, don't bother.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I really don’t know why people are dragging this palette. It’s actually great and the packaging is sooo pretty. Yes it’s a different formula from the classic nars single blushes but that doesn’t make it bad. Using a nice large stippling brush I had to swirl it around a couple times to get it going at first to pick up the product but now it applies just as smoothly as my other nars blushes, less powdery with this smoother formula and giving a nice wash of color across the cheeks. I saw this palette last spring when it came out and passed up on it over two vib sales but finally gave in this past sale. I am a nars blush lover so maybe I’m biased but this pretty palette def deserves better reviews. It’s just as great inside as it’s pretty on the outside!

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
Oh my goodness, I can't believe I waited so long to get this palette! I have so many of the limited edition NARS blush palettes and love them all, but got to a point where I felt that I probably had enough blush. After waffling on this particular palette since it was released, I finally broke down and bought it- and I love it. I am very fair, so take this with a grain of salt, but even so, these blushes can be built up to be very pigmented, and I have to use a light hand to not deposit too much color. I use a slightly stiffer, small blush brush since this is a harder-pressed product, and it picks up plenty of pigment without needing to use the product wet. What I love about this formula is that it looks incredibly natural. The texture is perfectly skin-like; it's a luminous satin finish with no shimmer (except in the highlight shade) that just melts into the skin. If you're contemplating this palette, I'd encourage you to give it a chance, even if you're unfamiliar with this particular blush formula. The shades may not suit every skin tone equally well, but I do not believe this palette suffers from a lack of pigment. If you have it and wish it were more pigmented, try using a slightly stiffer brush (or a damp brush, as the product description suggests for more opaque coverage).

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
This was genuinely the worst NARS product I've ever tried. I've been a huge fan of their products for years now, so to encounter such a massive dud was surprising! Like the other reviewers mentioned - you have to SCRUB your brush into the pan to even pick up any color. The color that my brushes picked up would be apply "streakily" onto my face. I get that they are trying to adopt a "creamy" formula, but the issue with that is that textures may not play well with skin that already has foundation and powder layered on. Applying the blush wet wasn't a winner either - I ended up with clown cheeks! Ultimately, this was one of the first NARS products I have ever returned. I just couldn't find a practical use for it, and applying it was way more work than it was worth. Gorgeous packaging and design, but the formula was a big no-no from me.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
This is a great palette. The packaging is incredibly sturdy and feels very lux. Girls with nails beware- the clasp is hard to open. I actually like that, because I know it won't ever stop closing by being losing integrity. This is a "gelée" formula. There isn't any fallout. You need a stiffer brush to use at first. They get easier to pick up after a couple of uses. The colors are amazing. Every blush color has a sheen to them, but are not metallic. They do not have glitter or sparkles. *Swatches were not built up* Top row- Left to right: The highlight is a pinky champagne. It has micro glitter in it that is incredibly fine. Can be subdued or more impactful. 2nd color is a light orange blush that leans coral. 3rd shade is a burnt organgey brown shade. Can be used alone as a blush bronzer or with the 2nd shade in this row. 2nd row- left to right: 1st shade is a true coral shade. 2nd color is a medium pink shade. The 3rd shade is a dark pink- magenta shade. I am 120 in fenty, Nars Mont Blanc, Laura mercier cameo, Hourglass stick in cream, Tarte fair beige. All of these shades work for me. I think this palette can work on a variety of different skin tones because the formula is buildable. I'm not sure about the highlight on the deepest skin, but I think most of the other shade will work very well.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Dark', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_title: Another amazing cheek palette from Nars!
review_content:
Nars never disappoints with their cheek palettes and this one is no exception. While I already have 5 cheek palettes from Nars, I had to add this one to my collection. The packaging is beautiful and the colors are a dream. Ignore the reviews that say there is little pigmentation. I’m NW45 in MAC/410 in Fenty and these blushes show on me with just a minimal amount on the brush. Obviously, the two lightest colors I could use as contours. However, the other 4 are great blush colors. My favorite so far is Give It Away. It’s the best neutral/natural/subtle cheek color for me. I could wear this practically every day. This color and Nars’ Taos are my favorite blushes. Pick up this limited edition before it’s gone.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: This palette is beautiful! The shades are very buildable, which I prefer in a blush. They do become more pigmented after a few uses and using a precise or more dense brush helps! I even enjoy using the darker shade for a little bronze glowy action. The highlight is okay; it isn’t the greatest!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Absolutely, Positively, The Best Blush Palette
review_content:
Con’s: This Palette might not show up too vividly on deeper skin tones (Hoping they come out with a dark version, I will still purchase that too). Pro’s: Let’s just get packaging out of the way, Nars is the master for makeup packaging, it’s breathtaking and makes doing makeup so much fun, especially if you love blush, reaching for this every morning is going to be a must. Now to the important stuff, this is the best blush palette I’ve ever purchased and typically I’m against splurging on Nars. Some people are obsessed with brows, lips, eyeshadow, highlight... I’m obsessed with blush. I’ve purchased from nearly every brand, and have yet to be fully satisfied. I have textured cheeks (I am a boy - part time, and shave constantly) so my pores are deep, and typically blushes will become patchy when applied or highlight my texture... not this blush formula. The formula is s-t-u-n-n-i-n-g. I don’t know how, but it blurs my pores. You cannot see my pores at all once the blush is applied. The colors are so beautiful on the cheeks, I cannot stress that enough. The formula is buildable, blendable, beautiful, natural, blissful. The highlighter is surprisingly gorgeous, doesn’t grab or expose texture, it’s blinding with one swipe, has shimmer particles much like the Fenty highlighters but is less texture grabby. In summary, do not feel guilty for throwing down $60 on this palette, if you’re tired of your current blush stash, have been trying lackluster blushes, look no further. This is my favorite blush palette I’ve ever purchased and I do not say that lightly, I’ve spent hundreds on blushes and have only had a few tried and true. This palette and formula blows everything else out of the water.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Love, love, love this pallet, best in awhile! Getting 6 different well portioned boxes of blush is a plus. All the colors are great and very layerable and buildable. I am medium warm complected and for a pink but not too pink and noticeable cheek I use three of them. I start with a layer of the pink second in the bottom row as a stein base, layer on a bit of the bottom row right, and dust just a touch of the bottom right on top to blend the two together for a more seamless look. I am admitted product junkie who rotates between 10-12 blushes so as the fact this is my go to means something.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I love this palette, it is so gorgeous on all skin tones and it stays on ALL DAY! Also I love using it for eye shadow crease or lid shades, you can even WET THE blush shades and wear them brighter! Such beautiful texture! I do not regret buying this one bit! Good job NARS team!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I bought this palette before there were reviews, and when I first got it and swatched it, I was really worried this was going to be a bust. Then the more negative reviews started coming in, and I was even more concerned. But, I actually love this palette. I think all the shades are really beautiful, are buildable, and last all day. The colors look absolutely nothing like the swatch photos, which is important to note. I apply these with a natural-hair brush, so I can't speak to how well they apply with synthetic brushes. My biggest concern with blush is that the color not fade throughout the day, and my Nars blushes have always provided long-wear color. This palette is no different, which I love.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
I'm not sure why some people are having issues with the pigment in these. I've worn 2 so far and they have been beautiful, and I have medium skin. In fact, the darkest color I had to tone down because it showed up much darker than I expected. The instructions did say to swirl brushes in a few times to get it started, but I didn't feel I needed to. I used a basic Morphe blush brush with rougher hairs, so maybe using a super soft brush doesn't work, but it worked just fine for me. The two I've worn so far were really pretty and lasted all night. Can't wait to try the rest!

review_title: Learn how to use it and you’ll love it!
review_content:
This is a beautiful palette! I tried it in store first and couldn’t understand what others were talking about - all of the colours are evenly pigmented and apply beautifully. They have a pearl in them which adds dimension to the blush to prevent a flat look. I did use it with a slightly denser brush and was able to blend it out well and build up the colour. The highlight has some shimmer but not anymore than other highlights. I also used the shade Give It Away (top right) as quick wash of colour as an eyeshadow and it stayed on great through my day with no primer.

review_content:
Let me tell it from the mountain top. These need to be applied with your FINGERS! There IS MOST DEFINITELY Pigment here. And they are gorgeous. But because of the creamier formula, they can’t really be picked up by a brush. The shade range is great. The shades blend well to create your own personal color. This was my first NARS product so I can’t speak on the consistency of their makeup but this is a great pallet. One star off because I do feel over $60 after tax is a bit much. The pans are fairly large but being that it’s blush I feel the pans could have been smaller but still adequate for a more reasonable price. Also,side note, the packaging is really cool
